name: Alumahan
description: A small coastal pelagic fish found in tropical Indo-Pacific waters, known for its rich flavor and commonly used in Filipino dishes like paksiw and sinigang.

name: Arosep Seaweed
description: A type of green seaweed known for its tiny, grape-like appearance and crisp texture, often eaten raw in salads (ensaladang lat√¥) with vinegar and tomatoes.

name: Bangus
description: The national fish of the Philippines, prized for its tender white flesh. Commonly prepared grilled, fried, or as sinigang. Known for its numerous fine bones.

name: Asohos
description: A slender, silver-white fish with dark bands, found in sandy coastal waters. Its delicate, sweet flavor makes it ideal for frying or grilling.

name: Bakoko
description: A streamlined fish with silver-gray to reddish-brown coloration, known for its mild yet distinctive flavor. Commonly found in coastal waters and popular in various cooking methods.

name: Bitilya
description: A colorful reef fish with elongated body and thread-like extensions on fins. Valued for its sweet, tender meat, often used in soups and stews.

name: Dalagang Bukid
description: A vibrant reef fish with a red belly and yellow tail, commonly found in schools. Its firm flesh is suitable for frying and grilling.

name: Dapa
description: A flatfish with both eyes on one side of its head, allowing it to lie flat on the seafloor. Known for its delicate flavor and tender texture.

name: Espada
description: A long, slender fish with a metallic sheen and sharp teeth. Its soft, white flesh is commonly grilled or fried.

name: Galunggong
description: A small, affordable fish with a distinct flavor, often dubbed the 'poor man's fish' in the Philippines. Commonly fried or used in stews.

name: Gindara
description: A prized fish known for its buttery texture and rich flavor, often used in Japanese miso recipes.

name: Kuhol
description: A freshwater snail often cooked in coconut milk (ginataang kuhol), popular in Filipino cuisine.

name: Hasa Hasa
description: A common Filipino fish known for its firm flesh, perfect for frying or in paksiw dishes.

name: Halaan Small/Medium
description: A popular shellfish used in soups like 'halaan sa luya' and seafood pasta dishes.

name: Halaan Large
description: Larger variant of halaan, known for its tender meat and savory broth when cooked.

name: Lapu-Lapu Black Genuine
description: A premium reef fish with firm flesh, often steamed or fried whole in festive Filipino meals.

name: Lato Seaweed
description: A type of edible green seaweed known for its pop-in-the-mouth texture, commonly eaten with vinegar.

name: Matambaka
description: A versatile fish often dried, fried, or grilled in local households across the Philippines.

name: Maya Maya
description: A beautiful red fish with mild, flaky flesh; ideal for sinigang or grilled preparations.

name: Pampano
description: A premium fish with rich flavor and delicate flesh, commonly grilled or baked whole.

name: Salay Ginto
description: A golden-hued fish ideal for frying and sweet and sour dishes.

name: Samaral
description: A reef fish with soft white flesh, commonly grilled or used in regional recipes.

name: Sapsap
description: A small flat fish known for its soft meat, usually fried or used in escabeche.

name: Shrimp Jumbo
description: Large, juicy shrimps perfect for grilling, sinigang, or tempura.

name: Shrimp Large
description: Flavorful large shrimps ideal for stir-fries, stews, or grilling.

name: Shrimp Small
description: Smaller shrimps commonly used in soups, sinigang, or tortang hipon.

name: Squid Baby
description: Small squids great for adobo, fried dishes, or inihaw na pusit.

name: Squid Large
description: Thick-fleshed squid excellent for stuffing and grilling.

name: Squid Medium
description: Medium-sized squid used in traditional Filipino dishes like adobong pusit.

name: Tahong Small
description: Small green mussels often steamed or cooked in soup with ginger and lemongrass.

name: Tahong Medium
description: Medium-sized green mussels commonly used in baked tahong or seafood stews.

name: Tahong Large
description: Large green mussels perfect for grilling, baking, or seafood platters.

name: Tawilis
description: The only freshwater sardine in the world, found in Taal Lake. Usually fried and dipped in vinegar.

name: Tilapia Medium/Large
description: A staple freshwater fish in Filipino homes, best when grilled or cooked in sinigang.

name: Tiger Prawns Jumbo
description: Large tiger prawns ideal for grilling, sizzling plates, and seafood platters.

name: Tiger Prawns XJumbo
description: Extra large prawns with firm meat, perfect for gourmet seafood meals.

name: Ulang / River Prawns
description: Large freshwater prawns known for their sweet meat, often grilled or cooked in coconut milk.

name: Yellow Fin
description: A popular tuna species with lean meat, ideal for sashimi, steaks, and local 'inihaw na tuna'.
